snippet: President Mohamed Morsi is betting that the Muslim Brotherhood’s political machine can overcome even the re-energized secular opposition.
abstract: News analysis; Egyptian Pres Mohamed Morsi is leaning more closely than ever on his Islamist allies in Muslim Brotherhood, betting on their political muscle to push through decisive victory in referendum on Egypt’s divisive draft constitution.

byline.contributor: Two employees of The New York Times contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: President Mohamed Morsi is betting that the Muslim Brotherhood’s political machine can overcome even the re-energized secular opposition.

headline.seo: As Egypt’s Crisis Deepens, Morsi Turns to Muslim Brotherhood
headline.main: Morsi Turns to His Islamist Backers as Egypt’s Crisis Grows
headline.print_headline: As Egypt’s Political Crisis Deepens, Morsi Turns to His Islamist Supporters

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject
